title: Backend Tester: fix output scrolling and correct live/demo messaging

requirements.summary: Make the Backend Tester bottom output panel reliably scrollable in normal and maximized states while preserving smart auto-scroll behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: When the Backend Tester has enough output to overflow, the output area can be scrolled with mouse wheel/trackpad, scrollbar drag, and touch (where applicable).
Scrolling works in both windowState='normal' and windowState='maximized'.
The output panel does not get 'stuck' due to parent container overflow/height constraints; the output region remains the only scrollable region for output content.
Auto-scroll-to-bottom continues to work when the user is at the bottom; if the user scrolls up, new output does not force-scroll them back down until they return to bottom.

file_operations.description: Fix layout/overflow constraints so the output region is the reliable scroll container in both normal and maximized window states (e.g., ensure the panel has a definite height in normal mode, maintain proper flex min-height boundaries). Add touch-friendly scrolling behavior for the output container, and refine auto-scroll detection to only keep pinned-to-bottom when the user is at/near the bottom.

requirements.summary: Update Backend Tester messaging and command metadata to accurately indicate Live vs Demo behavior and remove misleading demo/source text.
acceptanceCriteria: The note/banner text in the Backend Tester no longer implies the entire tester is in demo mode when at least some commands are live backend calls.
Commands that call the canister (use the actor) are clearly indicated as Live, and commands that return mock data are clearly indicated as Demo (either via label/badge/description).
Text is consistent between the command list and the informational note (no contradictions like 'demo mode' while running live calls).
No user-facing text mentions Kraken/API sources that are not actually being used by the command implementation (e.g., remove or correct 'Kraken API' in demo placeholders if it confuses live status).

file_operations.description: Add explicit command implementation metadata (e.g., Live vs Demo) to each command definition and update command descriptions to match actual behavior. Remove/replace misleading demo placeholders that reference external sources not actually used (e.g., 'Kraken API') so the command list is accurate and consistent.

Update the Backend Tester informational note/banner to reflect mixed Live/Demo commands (no blanket 'demo mode'). Add clear UI indication per command (e.g., label/badge in buttons and/or tooltip text) using the command metadata from backendTesterCommands.ts, ensuring the list and note are consistent.
